title: Danubia: A Personal History of Habsburg Europe
description:
by Simon Winder

For centuries much of Europe was in the hands of the very peculiar Habsburg family. An unstable mixture of wizards, obsessives, melancholics, bores, musicians and warriors, they saw offÃ¢â‚¬â€through luck, guile and sheer mulishnessÃ¢â‚¬â€any number of rivals, until finally packing up in 1918. From their principal lairs along the Danube they ruled most of Central Europe and Germany and interfered everywhereÃ¢â‚¬â€indeed the history of Europe hardly makes sense without them.

Danubia, Simon WinderÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s hilarious new book, plunges the reader into a maelstrom of alchemy, skeletons, jewels, bear-moats, unfortunate marriages and a guinea-pig village. Full of music, piracy, religion and fighting, it is the history of a strange dynasty, and the people they ruled, who spoke many different languages, lived in a vast range of landscapes, believed in rival gods and often showed a marked ingratitude towards their oddball ruler in Vienna. Readers who discovered Simon WinderÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s storytelling genius and infectious curiosity in Germania will be delighted by the eccentric and fascinating tale of the Habsburgs and their world.

Genre: Non Fiction | History | Travel
